subject: Cybersecurity
title: Cyber Norms and the Geneva Convention: Rules of Digital War
description: One-minute skill: Cyber Norms and the Geneva Convention: Rules of Digital War.

hook.text: The Geneva Convention protects hospitals in war. No equivalent exists for cyber attacks on hospitals â€“ and.

buildup.text: The Red Cross has called for a 'digital Geneva Convention' to protect civilian infrastructure from state cyber attacks.

discovery.text: Microsoft proposed that nations agree not to attack civilian infrastructure, plant backdoors, or hoard vulnerabilities.

twist.text: Despite proposals, hospitals have been hit by ransomware linked to state actors. A patient died during a 2020 attack.

climax.text: Without binding cyber norms, civilian infrastructure remains a legitimate target in the digital battlefield.

punchline.text: A hospital was attacked. A patient died. No treaty stopped it.

quiz.question: Why is a 'digital Geneva Convention' being proposed?
options: To protect civilian digital infrastructure from state-sponsored cyber attacks
